intro: Ozanonia hacquetii, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other members such as nettles and bladderworts. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins. It produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, typically in early spring. Ozanonia hacquetii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
